parameters.content:
## Set and format date/time
Those nodes are responsible for setting a current date and time in format `dd-MM-yyyy/H:mm`. Date and time are used to compose commit messages in GitHub, for example: `backup-12-07-2023/14:18`.

## Make a list of existing files
Return a list of existing files (backups) in GitHub repository. Data returned by those nodes is used by "IF" node (later in workflow) to check whether the backup files should be created or updated.

## Retrieve workflows
Get all workflows form your n8n instance. Remember that **your credentials need to point to the instance that you want to backup.**

nodes.name: url
nodes.notes:
"URL": "{{ $('List files from repository [GITHUB]').all()[$node["Loop Over Items"].context["currentRunIndex"]].json.download_url }}"

current.name: Demo: My first AI Agent in n8n

options.systemMessage:
=You're a helpful assistant that helps the user answer questions about their calendar.

Today is {{ $now.format('cccc') }} the {{ $now.format('yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm') }}.

parameters.content:
## 👋 Welcome to n8n!
This example shows how to build an AI Agent that interacts with your 
calendar.

### 1. Connect your accounts
- Set up your [OpenAI credentials](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/credentials/openai/?utm_source=n8n_app&utm_medium=credential_settings&utm_campaign=create_new_credentials_modal) in the `OpenAI Model` node 
- Connect your Google account in the `Google Calendar` node credentials section

### 2. Ready to test it?
Click Chat below and start asking questions! For example you can try `What meetings do I have today?`
Don't have **Google Calendar**? Simply exchange this with the **Microsoft Outlook** or other tools

### Want to learn more?
Want to learn more about AI and how to apply it best in n8n? Have a look at our [new tutorial series on YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yzvLfHb0nqE&lc).

nodes.name: Check if file exists in repository

parameters.content:
## Set and format date/time
Those nodes are responsible for setting a current date and time in format `dd-MM-yyyy/H:mm`. Date and time are used to compose commit messages in GitHub, for example: `backup-12-07-2023/14:18`.

## Make a list of existing files
Return a list of existing files (backups) in GitHub repository. Data returned by those nodes is used by "IF" node (later in workflow) to check whether the backup files should be created or updated.

## Retrieve workflows
Get all workflows form your n8n instance. Remember that **your credentials need to point to the instance that you want to backup.**

main.node: Check if file exists in repository
